quest.name: The Piping of the Dead
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
Haraldur has found a piece of lost property.
objectives: Give the extravagant pipe to the chiseled miner.

dialogue.name: HARALDUR
dialogue.text: 'Scuse me, missmate. That bloke you were talking to dropped his pipe.

dialogue.name: HARALDUR
dialogue.text: It seems sort of old. Might be worth something.

dialogue.name: HARALDUR
dialogue.text: I'd run over and give it back to him, but I've got a job to do. Maybe you could do it instead?

dialogue.name: HARALDUR
dialogue.text: It don't look like the sort of pipe you'd throw away.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: Let me guess, my boy's up to his old tricks again?

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: My pipe! I've been looking for this. I can't thank you enough for bringing it back to me!

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: There's a bit of a story behind it, you see.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: If you have the time, please come and meet me in the graveyard. I'd like to tell you a tale, if I may.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: I'm glad you decided to join me. You see, this pipe was once owned by a much loved and respected member of our community, who now rests beneath this very soil.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: He was a good friend to many of us, myself included, and came from a long line of Ronso going all the way back to the great Nuvy. The mine was named after his ancestor.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: He always felt a sense of pride in his work, and led digs that went deeper and deeper into the rock.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: No matter what happened, he never gave up. After the Talos masters left fifteen years ago, we ran into all sorts of problems. We lost so many good workers to cave-ins, sin eater attacks, injury, and simply leaving for better prospects elsewhere. Even then, he kept digging.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: Though he is no longer with us, we try to follow the example he set. I always carry his old pipe with me as a memento of the days we spent together.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: I'm grateful to you for taking the time to listen. It's good to know that someone from outside of Twine has an interest in the work we do and the reasons why we keep going, in spite of everything.

dialogue.name: FATHER03514
dialogue.text: Which reminds me, I need to see the others about getting rid of those wretched gnomes, but I hope I will have the chance to speak with you again one day. Fare thee well.
